introduction: In this video, we will explore the process of building a job board app, starting with a minimum viable product (MVP) using a single data feed from a job board API. The frontend will be developed in React and Material UI, while the backend will use an Express server and Redis for data storage. The algorithm will filter job listings based on seniority, manager roles, and years of experience. The video covers topics related to web development, software engineering, and data science.

sections.title: Section 1: Setting up the project
content: Initializing the project with Create React App
Creating components for jobs and a single job
Setting up typography and variant typography

sections.title: Section 2: Frontend development
content: Styling the job list component with CSS
Adding pagination to the job list component

sections.title: Section 3: Backend development
content: Implementing the job filtering algorithm on the backend
Creating a cron job to fetch and refresh job listings

sections.title: Section 4: Deployment
content: Testing the deployed job board app
Finalizing the job board app for public use

sections.title: Section 5: Conclusion
content: Summary of the job board app development process
Discussion of future improvements and expansions
Final thoughts on the importance of job board apps for entry-level developers
